title: Quiz 5: Basic Home Nursing Skills
description: Test on practical nursing skills including bed baths, pressure area care, and wound care.

questions.question: Order the general steps of a Bed Bath procedure:
questions.explanation: Preparation -> Explanation -> Action -> Cleanup -> Final Hygiene.
questions.hint: Start with getting ready, end with cleaning up.

questions.question: Which of the following are effective measures to PREVENT pressure sores? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Turning the patient every 2 to 4 hours
Keeping bed sheets dry and straight
Keeping the patient in the same position to allow rest

questions.explanation: Immobility causes pressure sores. Turning, massage, and dry sheets prevent them.

questions.question: A home remedy for pressure sores involves packing the sore with a cloth soaked in ___BLANK___ milk to help remove old flesh.
questions.explanation: Papaya/Pawpaw milk contains enzymes that help debride (soften/remove) dead tissue in sores.

questions.question: When cleaning a wound, you should wash from the edges inwards to the centre.
questions.explanation: You should wash around the edge first, then wash from the centre OUT to the edges (or clean to dirty) to avoid contaminating the clean centre.
questions.hint: Think about moving dirt away from the wound.

questions.question: What mixture can be used as a home remedy to kill germs and speed healing in sores?
questions.explanation: A thick paste of honey and sugar helps kill germs and prevent infection.

questions.question: When performing mouth care for an unconscious patient, why is a padded spoon used?

options.text: To keep the mouth open safely

questions.explanation: A padded spoon is used to gently keep the mouth open without damaging the teeth or gums.

questions.question: Match the nursing care activity to its purpose:

pairs.right: Promote salivary flow and maintain freshness
Reduce collection of micro-organisms and prevent self-injury
Prevent joint stiffness and muscle wasting

questions.explanation: Each activity targets a specific hygiene or physiological goal.
questions.hint: Connect the action to the benefit.

questions.question: When laundering soiled linen from a patient with an infectious disease, what steps should be taken? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Wash immediately with cold water only without soap

questions.explanation: Protective gear, decontamination (Jik), and disinfection (boiling) are critical. Proper washing with soap is required.
